html:
B&H Photo has the Delkin Devices 650GB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B memory card in their DealZone for $239 (Reg $299). We use Delkin cards and haven’t run into any problems with them.

Purchase Options

Delkin Devices 650GB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B $239 (Reg $299)

Overview

  • 650GB Storage Capacity
  • PCIe Interface
  • Max Read Speed: 3530 MB/s
  • Max Write Speed: 3250 MB/s
  • Records Raw 8K, 6K, and 4K Video
  • Records High Bitrates and Frame Rates
  • Records Raw Photos and Rapid Bursts
  • Serialized for Added Protection
  • Water, Shock, and X-Ray Proof
  • Can Withstand Temperature Extremes

Combining reliability and performance, the 650GB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card from Delkin Devices features a storage capacity of 650GB and is designed for professional photographers, videographers, and high-end hosts.

It is well-suited for raw and continuous-burst photography as well as raw 8K, 6K, and 4K video at high bitrates and frame rates.

Thanks to a PCIe interface, you’ll be able to achieve maximum read speeds of up to 3530 MB/s and maximum write speeds of up to 3250 MB/s. In addition, this card features sustained write speeds of 2060 MB/s.

Packaging Info

When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here's how it works.

Craig is the founder and editorial director for Canon Rumors. He has been writing about all things Canon for more than 17 years. When he's not writing, you can find him shooting professional basketball and travelling the world looking for the next wildlife adventure. The Canon EOS R1 is his camera of choice.
